Package embedding.nearestNeighbors

Class ConnectedComponents

java.lang.Object
embedding.nearestNeighbors.ConnectedComponents
public class ConnectedComponents
extends java.lang.Object
A ConnectedComponents instance is used to work with the connected components of a graph given as AdjacencyList. The graph can be tested for connectedness and be joined if unconnected.
Author:
Anton Ballmaier

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private class  ConnectedComponents.KruskalEdge
    Representation of a single edge in the graph of graph components.

  • Field Details

    • adjacencyList

      private final AdjacencyList adjacencyList
      The a adjacency list representing the graph this instance deals with.

    • components

      private java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> components
      List of all connected components within the graph. The components are sorted by size, the first component being the largest component.

  • Constructor Details

    • ConnectedComponents

      public ConnectedComponents​(AdjacencyList adjacencyList)
      Constructs a new ConnectedComponents object from an AdjacencyList. The components will be identified upon instantiation.
      Parameters:
      adjacencyList - the adjacency list representing the graph this instance deals with

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect​(Measure<java.lang.Integer> measure)
      Connects the components of the handled graph to a single component.

      The connection is constructed as a minimal spanning tree of the component graph. The added edges in the original graph will each be the shortest connections possible. Afterwards the graph has only one connected component.

      Parameters:
      measure - the measure used to determine distances between vertices in the graph

    • getComponents

      public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getComponents()
      Returns the connected components of the graph.
      Returns:
      the connected components of the graph

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Tests whether the graph is connected.

      This doesn't reflect changes made externally to the AdjacencyList used to construct this instance.

      Returns:
      true if the graph is connected, false otherwise.

    • mainComponent

      public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> mainComponent()
      Returns the vertices of the largest component of the graph.
      Returns:
      the vertices of the largest component of the graph

    • connectComponentsMST

      private void connectComponentsMST​(java.util.LinkedList<ConnectedComponents.KruskalEdge> edges)
      Connects the graph components as sparingly as possible by constructing the minimal spanning tree from the graph components.

      This implementation uses kruskals algorithm. Since a graph usually doesn't have a lot of components, this implementation isn't optimized for asymptotic runtime.

      Parameters:
      edges - the possible edges between components

    • findComponents

      private void findComponents()
      Identifies the connected components in the graph.

      The components are identified by running a depth first search for each vertex that has not already been assigned to a component. The components are saved for this instance.

    • findShortestComponentConnections

      private java.util.LinkedList<ConnectedComponents.KruskalEdge> findShortestComponentConnections​(Measure<java.lang.Integer> measure)
      Calculates the closest pairs and their distance for every pair of connected components in the graph.
      Parameters:
      measure - the measure used to determine distances between vertices in the graph
      Returns:
      the possible edges between components
